ukip lose significant numbers of votes across county .
in clacton , the party has gone from getting 19,642 votes in 2015 to 3,357 this time around .
turnouts around the county up on 2015 levels .

documents.title: unemployed orient fan scoops £ 9.3m on the lottery
text: an unemployed football fan who scooped £ 9.3 million on the lottery said he refused to believe he had won because he feared it was a scam .
paul long , 55 , put his luck down to his beloved leyton orient 's 3-0 win against woking on saturday , which he celebrated by buying the winning lotto lucky dip ticket .
the father-of-three from wickford , essex , said he initially believed he had won £ 9,000 before his friend pointed out to him he had scooped the jackpot .
he received an email on sunday morning from camelot saying he had won but when he logged in , saw his account only had £ 3.90 left .
after ringing the customer helpline , he said he `` must have been in denial '' and came away believing he had won £ 9,000 .
mr long said : `` i 've rung my mate and told him and he said , 'text me the ticket over ' .
`` he then said : 'hi mate , i 'm not being funny , you 've won £ 9 million . '
`` i said : 'shut up .
`` he rang the lotto helpline back to confirm he was the sole jackpot winner and ask : 'is this a scam ?
mr long said : `` he said : 'yeah i confirm it 's £ 9 million - you 're a multi-millionaire , blah-de-blah . ' ''

documents.title: funding announcement for ipswich and colchester hospitals merger proposal
text: the proposed merger of ipswich and colchester hospitals could benefit from £ 69m in government funding - if it gets the go-ahead .
the health secretary jeremy hunt said the money would be available to help pay for improved facilities at the new trust .
a decision on the merger will be taken tomorrow .
mr hunt said £ 18m will also be available to develop urgent treatment walk-in hubs in clacton and harwich .

documents.title: a120 needs to be dualled says council leader
text: highways england is looking to carry out a major upgrade of the a120 between horsley cross and harwich , it 's been announced .
the upgrade would cost tens of millions of pouds and is necessary because the road 's 50-year-old concrete base is reaching the end of its life .

but the leader of tendring district council neil stock said he hopes highways england will consider more than an upgrade - he wants it to also develop proposals for a different route or for dualling the road .
in the meantime , mr stock said a planned £ 800,000 repair scheme to fix some of the road 's worst potholes will begin this week .

documents.title: several arrests after 'intimidating ' fight in southend
text: one person has been taken to hospital after a large-scale fight on london road in the centre of southend at about 19:00 last night .
essex police said six people were arrested on sus of public order offences , and remain in police custody .
a knife was found at the scene .
ch supt andy mariner said : `` this happened at a busy time of day in southend , and was witnessed by numerous members of the public , which must have been very intimidating .
`` this kind of behaviour will not be tolerated , and we dealt with the incident robustly and quickly .
`` you might see a few officers around the area tonight - please do n't be alarmed , they are there to carry out enquiries and answer any concerns you may have . ''

documents.title: empty clacton warehouse badly damaged by fire
text: a fire was started deliberately at an empty warehouse in key road in clacton last night .
essex fire service says firefighters were called to the incident at 23:00 .
several properties had to be evacuated , as the fire was in a residential area .
it was put out at 01:33 .

station manager lee palfreyman said : `` the close proximity of homes on all four sides of the warehouse , as well as the fact that the site itself is surrounded by overgrown foliage and discarded waste , made it very difficult to access initially . ''

the shortlisted buildings are :
all these buildings will be assessed by a regional jury during april , with the winning buildings announced on 24 may .

documents.title: health trust 's mental health services deemed 'unacceptable '
text: a health trust is being stripped of a contract after nhs commissioners described its mental health services as `` unacceptable '' .
essex partnership university nhs foundation trust ( eput ) provides a psychological therapy service for people in basildon and brentwood .
basildon and brentwood clinical commissioning group ( ccg ) said it was looking for a new provider .
the trust hit the headlines last week amid claims staff were supplying patients with class a drugs .
the ccg board was told failures in the contract for treating people with mild and moderate mental problems such as depression , anxiety and post traumatic stress , included :
· excessively long waiting times
· failures in referrals to crisis provision
· poor contact between the service and gps and patients .
`` gps are becoming cynical that [ the service ] is achieving anything for their patients , '' said a report to the board .
katherine kirk mbe , ccg governance committee chair , said : `` we 've had this service in place throughout south essex .
`` it 's never really delivered .
it 's been completely unacceptable for a long time . ''
eput said its psychology services had seen a `` significant reduction '' in waiting times .
`` our average wait from referral to first appointment is four days , '' said a spokesman .
the trust said there would be no redundancies if the contract is not retained .

documents.title: flight turns back after technical issue
text: the gr627 from stansted to guernsey returned to stansted `` as a precaution '' following `` a minor technical issue '' , an aurigny spokesman has said .
the aircraft landed normally and safely without incident .
passengers are being provided with overnight accommodation and will be rebooked onto a flight tomorrow .
alternatively , they are able to cancel and claim a refund . ''
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: london-based policeman due in court over colchester assault
text: a london-based british transport police officer ( btp ) is due to appear in court after being charged with assault by beating .
pc mohinder sandhu has been placed on restricted duties , while essex police continue to investigate an incident which happened on 21 january in colchester .
pc sandhu , who works at btp 's central london police station , will appear at colchester magistrates ' court on 1 may .

documents.title: police watchdog investigates colchester crash
text: a crash which left a driver in a critical condition shortly after he failed to stop for police officers in essex is being investigated by a watchdog .
the man in his 30s failed to stop in severalls lane in colchester on saturday night .
essex police said its officers lost sight of the car , which was then found to have had a serious crash at the junction with newcomen way .
the independent office for police conduct ( iopc ) has begun an investigation .

documents.title: mortar rocket removed from dunwich beach
text: part of a mortar rocket has been removed from the beach at dunwich in suffolk for `` safe disposal '' , the aldeburgh coastguard rescue team has said .
the team was contacted by two members of the public and , after investigation , photos were sent to an army explosive ordnance disposal ( eod ) team , based at colchester .
the eod visited the site and confirmed it was a tail end of a mortar rocket and was `` possibly still live '' .

documents.title: new chief executive for suffolk county council
text: suffolk county council has appointed a new chief executive .
nicola beach , who is currently executive director of infrastructure and environment at essex county council , will arrive at endeavour house this summer .
her £ 170,000-a-year appointment comes after the full council backed a unanimous recommendation by the authority 's staff appointments committee .
ms beach , who has lived in ipswich since 2005 , said she was `` delighted '' to be appointed as the county council 's chief executive .
she replaces sue cook , who has acted as interim chief executive since september 2017 when deborah cadman left suffolk county council .

documents.title: men threaten staff in domino 's pizza knife-point robbery
text: police have released cctv footage in a bid to track down four suspects after hundreds of pounds of cash was taken from a domino 's pizza shop in east london .
one suspect acted as lookout while three others threatened staff at the takeaway outlet on brentwood road , romford , at about midnight last wednesday .
at least one suspect had a knife , police said .
all four men are described as white males with local accents .
they made off on foot down great gardens road .

documents.title: tory mp defends tendering of blue passporteconomy debate
text: shadow chief secretary to the treasury peter dowd intervenes on tory clacton mp giles watling whilst he is making a series of points about how the brexit `` dividend '' should be spent .
if he were to travel to france , he asks , should he be able to take with him his `` new blue passport that is made in britain , or made in france ?
removing his own passport from a jacket pocket , mr watling replies that he is `` proud of my passport , which i carry here today '' .
`` if it 's blue , let 's make sure we get the best value for money in printing the things '' , he adds .
in response to a follow-up from peter dowd , he replies that `` we have to get the best deal possible '' .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: essex 's rob completes challenges for sport relief
text: i wonder how many of us could name 15 sports - let alone cram a go at them all into one day ?
essex 's rob jelly started at 05:00 this morning with a spot of boxing , before heading to clacton for synchronised swimming .
he 's also completed challenges in rugby , athletics , tennis , weightlifting and fencing .
on hand to help - reporter victoria polley said the day had been a series of highs - including a surprise appearance by olympian max whitlock during a challenge at south essex gymnastics club .
`` max was really impressed with rob , '' victoria said .
`` however , despite playing football until he was 18 , he really struggled with that challenge - he missed a penalty . ''
rob 's first job on his day off tomorrow will be a decent massage .
you can follow his progress for sport relief on the bbc essex twitter site .

documents.title: five east of england projects chosen for top 200
text: five east of england civil engineering projects have been added to a list of those that shaped the world .
to mark the 200th anniversary of the institution of civil engineers ( ice ) , it is highlighting 200 projects past and present from around the world throughout 2018 .

the willis building in ipswich ; felixstowe docks ( the offshore wind farm london array , which spans the thames estuary from margate to clacton on sea ; remnants of the world war two mulberry harbours at shoeburyness and the drainage of the fens have been included in the hall of fame .

nathan baker from ice said : `` the chosen projects showcase how civil engineering paved the way to modern life and how it continues to tackle the problems of today , safeguarding the future for generations to come . ''

documents.title: contractor called in to clear fly-tipped rubbish
text: council officers say they had to bring in a `` specialist contractor '' to remove a huge mound of fly-tipped rubbish in essex .
it 's believed the pile was dumped in hurrells lane near little baddow on saturday morning .
in a statement , chelmsford city council said the contractor was called in due to the size of the pile - but did not say how much it had cost the authority .
`` fly-tipping is a selfish way to dispose of waste , blighting our environment and potentially resulting in a fine of up to £ 50,000 or 12 months in prison , '' the council added .

documents.title: plans for link road on site of ancient woodland thrown out
text: councillors have decided against plans to approve a link road on the site of an ancient woodland .
developer taylor wimpey wanted to demolish part of frith wood in billericay to facilitate the building of 300 houses on an adjoining site .
the wood is linked to a rights of way used by ramblers and horse riders , and a common .
the proposal formed part of draft plan for almost 20,000 new homes for the whole borough and was discussed at a meeting of basildon council 's infrastructure , growth and development committee .
billericay town councillor lesley mitchelmore said loss of the woodland would effect the character of the town and have a negative impact on the bridleway .

documents.title: two lanes closed by broken down lorry on m25 in essex
text: there are more problems for motorists on the m25 in essex this lunchtime , after a lorry broke down .
highways england said two lanes were closed on the anti-clockwise stretch of the road between junctions 28 ( brentwood/romford ) and junction 27 ( m11 ) .
this google traffic flow map gives a scale of the delays being experienced
last night , in a separate incident , two women were killed and a 10-year-old girl seriously injured in a crash between a car and a lorry on the motorway near waltham abbey .
we 're on scene with a broken down hgv ( brakes locked on ) .
currently have 2 lanes closed # m25 anti-clockwise between j28 and j27 while we deal and arrange recovery .
long delayts in the area due to the on-going incident between j27 and j26 .

documents.title: basildon shop owners face eviction for new development
text: about 20 shop owners and traders in basildon could be evicted if they refuse to leave the town centre to make way for a new multi-million pound development .

compulsory purchase orders were approved by basildon borough council last night for an area which includes businesses in east square , where a new cinema , restaurants and coffee shops will be built .
conservative councillor kevin blake , for burstead ward , said : `` most will go willingly , but perhaps not all .
the council insisted it will do its best to help people move and talks are expected to continue despite last night 's vote .
mr blake added : `` we do n't want to force people to leave .
but you ca n't hold up a project for the odd few . ''

documents.title: london men jailed over 'violent ' bournemouth jewellery raid
text: two men have been jailed after a staff member had a gun held to his head during a `` violent '' armed robbery at a bournemouth jewellers .

mustafa ali , 25 , of sandringham road , dalston , east london , and michael adiat , 23 , of maundeville street , lower clapton , east london , admitted robbery and possession of a firearm at franses jewellers on westover road on 31 january last year .
ali also admitted raids in essex , buckinghamshire and bedfordshire .
ali was jailed for 16 years with five years on licence .
adiat was jailed for 12 years with three years on licence .
this was a violent offence and a very frightening ordeal for the victims , who all showed considerable bravery in the circumstances .

documents.title: two norfolk locations named among best places to live in uk
text: two places in norfolk have been included on the sunday times best places to live list for 2018 .
norwich and wymondham are two of 12 locations from across the east of england to be included on the list .
suffolk is represented by bungay , orford , woodbridge and hadleigh while chelmsford in essex was named the number one spot in the top 12 places to live in the east .
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: alresford landslip : line 'may not re-open until monday '
text: train operator greater anglia is warning commuters that services between colchester and clacton may not get back to normal until monday following wednesday night 's landslip which has forced the closure of the line .
network rail engineers are working on repairs to `` extensive damage to an embankment '' between alresford and great bentley .
greater anglia said that the network rail team will be working `` round the clock '' to re-open the line , but `` current estimates are that train services will not resume until monday '' .
the latest updates are on the greater anglia website .

documents.title: college student stabbed in the bottom in loughton
text: a teenager has been taken to hospital after being stabbed in the bottom .
police were called to the incident in borders lane , loughton at around 13:00 .
officers are searching for four potential suspects , police said .
epping forest college confirmed the victim was one of their students .
a college spokesman said : '' the incident allegedly involved three males who are not students of the college .
`` the victim returned to the college by himself and was given immediate first aid treatment .
police and ambulance were called to the scene .
the victim 's family were informed and he was taken to hospital for further treatment .
`` the college grounds have been checked and for a short while an alternative entrance and exit from the side of the college was arranged to assist with the police investigation .
`` the college remains safe and is open as normal with the main exit and entrance open . ''

documents.title: 'porky ' label unfair and abusive to pigs , farmer says
text: an essex farmer is calling for terms like `` porker '' and `` pig-out '' to be banned as they 're discouraging people from eating pork and are unfair to pigs .
fergus howie , from wicks manor farm in tolleshunt major , has written to the oxford english dictionary and demanded the terms are removed from future editions as being abusive .
he 's angry that the animal is always being used as a symbol for gluttony and this is discouraging shoppers from considering pork as a leaner alternative to other meats :
`` when people say 'eating like a pig ' it 's not good as it affects people 's perceptions of what pork is .
`` it 's actually a fantastic meat with very little fat , '' mr howie said .

documents.title: murder trial begins after man extradited from venezuela
text: a man extradited from venezuela has appeared in court charged with the murder of a teenager in essex .
nico ramsay , 19 , from london , was found with a stab wound to the chest in napier avenue , southend , in february 2016 and died four days later .
allcie houlder , 22 , of mantle way , stratford , was arrested in caracas in november 2016 .
he was returned to the uk in september and his trial started today at chelmsford crown court .

documents.title: no fossil fuel for us , anglia ruskin university pledges
text: anglia ruskin university has become one of only 10 uk universities to sign up to the fossil fuel declaration , meaning it has no investments in extractor fossil fuel companies , and pledges to remain fossil-free in the future .

the declaration recognises that in december 2015 , 195 countries signed the paris agreement which seeks to keep global temperature increases , calculated to be as a result of climate change , below 2.0c ( 35.6f ) and `` endeavour to limit '' them even more , to 1.5c ( 34.7f ) .

`` the fossil fuel declaration is not just a recognition of the importance that students place on their university 's wider global responsibility , but also that , as the world has signed up to transition to a low-carbon future , these types of investment represent a risk in the short to medium term as policies align with this new future , '' said the university 's professor aled jones , director of its global sustainability institute .

documents.title: museum looks to buy gold coins found in piano
text: a museum in essex is hoping to buy part of a hoard of gold coins found hidden inside a piano in shropshire .
the 913 gold sovereigns and half sovereigns were wrapped in bags and newspaper , but it 's not clear who they belong to .
the piano was made in london and originally sold to two music teachers in saffron walden in 1906 .
it was later purchased by a family in the area in the 1980s and they donated it to bishop 's castle community college , in south shropshire , in 2016 .
the coins were found by a piano tuner last year and after being declared treasure were offered up for purchase to the british museum and the saffron walden museum .
the museum in essex is now looking to raise £ 3,000 to acquire 12 coins , along with the packaging they were found in and the piano .

documents.title: leigh-on-sea secures funding to help port stay open
text: funding to help keep open a traditional thames estuary fishing port in essex has been approved by a local council .
southend-on-sea borough council has secured £ 71,195 of european funding for a study to help leigh-on-sea port remain accessible by all maritime uses , including the fishing and cockling industries .
approaches to the dockside area in the town are subject to silting and european funding for the study has been awarded to the north thames fisheries local action group ( ntflag ) .
ann holland , executive councillor for culture , tourism and the economy and member of ntflag , said : `` this community has been important in shaping how the area has developed .
however , in recent times the fishing industry has come under increasing pressures , in part due to the silting up of leigh creek which restricts vessel access .
`` the traditional and active fishing port is the last of its kind within the thames estuary and a crucial part of the local economy .
therefore , it is important to establish sustainable solutions for long-term access to the port . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: hospitals seek almost £ 1.6m in patients ' unpaid bills
text: almost £ 1.6m is owed to hospitals in essex by overseas patients who are yet to pay for their treatment .
figures obtained by the bbc under the freedom of information act show the five hospitals are seeking just over a third of the £ 2.5m cost of treating non-eu patients since 2015 .
among them is a man from india who owes £ 94,000 for his treatment for sepsis at the princess alexandra hospital in harlow .
nick alston , chairman of mid essex hospital trust , said : `` we need to crack down on health tourists - people who deliberately come here for treatment and can not pay - and we are doing that . ''
earlier this month , it was reported that a nigerian woman has run up a £ 330,000 bill for nhs treatment after she gave birth prematurely to quadruplets in a london hospital .

the 64-year-old victim was stabbed in the chest after being approached by two men on london road , purfleet , at about 20:30 on tuesday , 16 january .
just before the incident he had had a brief conversation with a man in a beige coat when his dog crossed the man 's path .
this man is described as white , aged 30 to 40 , about 5ft 10in ( 1.78m ) , of average build with dark hair .

documents.title: devon town 's french connection 'not at risk '
text: a devon town which thought it had been secretly spurned by its french twin in favour of an essex `` rival '' has been reassured its entente is intact .
bovey tracey was twinned with le molay-littry in normandy in 1979 .
bovey tracey town council was alarmed when it was told unofficially the relationship was over , but this was never confirmed by french officials .
le molay-littry 's mayor , guillaume bertier , told the bbc the `` rumour '' the twinning was over is `` false '' .
however , the french town is now looking to twin with theydon bois , essex , and wants links with both english suitors .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

remember , you can watch it arriving at norwich station from 13:15 here .

documents.title: watch oliver cromwell 's last trip
text: a steam-powered locomotive which spent most of its working life as the london to norwich express is having one final hurrah on the line today before it goes out of service .
the 70013 oliver cromwell , built in 1951 , is due to be withdrawn in march after its boiler certificate expires .
it is making the return trip from london liverpool street to norwich , stopping at colchester at 11:44 .
it 's already on its way up the coast , having set off from liverpool street at 10:20 .
you can watch it arriving at norwich station from 13:15 here .
after a five-hour stop , it 'll then leave norwich at 19:05 and arrive back at liverpool street at 22:24 .

text: a 37-year-old tottenham man has been found guilty at the old bailey of preparing for acts of terrorism .
aweys faqey , was arrested on 23 may at stansted airport , the prosecution claimed during the trial that faqey intended to travel to syria and/or iraq to join isis .

documents.title: lecturers to walk out at university of essex on thursday
text: staff at the university of essex are to walkout on thursday in a row over pensions - one of 64 universities where lecturers will be striking over the next four weeks .
more than 14,000 students at the establishment 's three campuses will be affected - colchester , southend and loughton .
university and college union members voted for industrial action because they say plans for pension changes could leave lecturers £ 10,000 a year worse off in retirement .

in a blog , the university of essex 's vice-chancellor professor anthony forster has criticised the proposal by universities uk ( uuk ) , which represents university employers , and said there was `` still time to find common ground '' .

documents.title: baby murder charge woman appears in court via video link
text: a 31-year-old woman , charged with murdering a seven-month-old baby girl last year , has appeared in court via video link .
shalina kukkundoor padmanabha , of epping new road in buckhurst hill , did not enter a plea , a court official said .
the press and members of the public were asked to leave before the hearing at chelmsford crown court and judge patricia lynch qc conducted the procedure in chambers .
the baby girl had sustained multiple fractures when she was found in the early hours of 15 august and was taken to hospital where she was pronounced dead .
judge lynch ordered that the name of the dead child should not be reported .
ms padmanabha is next due to appear at chelmsford crown court for a plea hearing on 12 march .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: police get 'dispersal ' powers after colchester fight
text: police have been given special powers to clear part of an essex town centre if anti-social behaviour should break out following a `` large disturbance '' near a nightclub on saturday .
bottles were thrown as a small group of men fought in colchester high street at about the same time as people were leaving the club .
police applied to the local council for a dispersal order which gave officers powers to clear a defined area .
an 18-year-old man from north finchley was charged with with using threatening or disorderly behaviour likely to cause harassment , alarm and distress .
the order runs until 18:30 today and anyone who refuses to leave the area once directed can be arrested and , if convicted , they could face up to a three-month prison sentence and £ 2,500 fine .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: wheelie bins being considered for homes in tendring
text: homes in the tendring district could be given free wheelie bins to replace the black sacks currently used for rubbish collection .
the change is being considered as part of a new waste contract and could be introduced from summer 2019 .
tendring district council said the current bags are prone to splitting and can be ripped apart by animals , causing litter and the need for extra street cleaning .
recycling arrangements , assisted collections and the weekly food waste collection would remain unchanged and a four-week public consultation has begun to garner people 's views .

documents.title: conservative councillor wins clacton st paul 's by-election
text: susan honeywood ( conservative ) has been elected to represent the tendring district council ward of st paul 's in clacton , following yesterday 's by-election .
the turnout for the vote was 25.5 % , with mrs honeywood polling 378 votes to succeed jack parsons ( independent ) , who resigned from the conservative-run authority in december .
prior to his resignation , parsons was fined and given a 12 month community order after he was convicted of carrying a knife in a public place last year .
second and third places in the election were taken by independent candidates , while labour was fourth .
full results of the by-election for st paul 's ward .

documents.title: 'neigh-bourhood ' cops round up stray horses
text: police officers had to use their cars to create a road block to protect other motorists after four horses were spotted running loose .
`` neigh-bourhood '' officers from essex police 's community team put their horse-herding skills to the test on lower road in hullbridge , near rayleigh , on sunday night .
concerned for both the safety of the animals and motorists , they blocked off the road for about an hour , and secured the animals with help from members of the public
`` not every incident we attend is a crime but an incident like this can potentially cause serious harm to the public , '' pc steve joynes said .
`` we 're glad we resolved it without any injury and the horses were put back in their field safely . ''

the device was discovered at the king george v dock on sunday during planned work at the east london airport .

documents.title: always the bridesmaid : streets fail in 'most romantic name ' bid
text: two streets in the east of england in the running to be crowned as having the `` most romantic name '' have failed to top a public poll .
fourteen streets across the uk were shortlisted by charity living streets - among them trueloves lane in ingatestone , essex , and sweetpea way in orchard park , cambridge .
while both sound very romantic - and more than 1,200 people took part in the poll - they failed to beat the loved-up love street in paisley , scotland , which came out on top .
trueloves lane , however managed second place with 159 votes - only five fewer than the winner , while sweetpea way came in sixth place with 126 votes .
union street in manchester came in last , with only 28 votes .

text: an essex tree whose beauty has already been recognised at a national level is now in the running to take the title for european tree of the year 2018 .
the gilwell oak in epping forest was reputedly used by scouts founder robert baden-powell as a metaphor for the movement 's growth .

voting for the european title opens today and runs until 28 february .

documents.title: former harlow leader 'blames left wing group for resignation '
text: jon clempner has blamed the labour party left wing campaigning group momentum for his decision to step down a fortnight ago as the leader of harlow council and as a member of the party .

in a blog post today , he says activists at a national and local level `` target labour councillors and labour councils that do not conform to the particular form of ideological purity that seems to have taken a grip of the party '' .

while not elaborating on these claims , the chairman of harlow labour party , charlie cochrane , issued a statement saying `` while there is real sadness about jon going , we are determined to carry on his good work and to deliver on his legacy '' .
a new leader will be elected tonight .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Essex Political Reporter

documents.title: are you feeling the love ?
text: two streets in the eastern region are in the running to be crowned as having the uk 's most romantic name .
sweetpea way in orchard park , cambridge , and trueloves lane in ingatestone , essex are among 14 roads which have made it on to a shortlist compiled by the charity living streets .

`` we 've carefully selected 14 lovely sounding streets from the areas in and around where living streets delivers projects and we want to know which one you think should be crowned 'most romantic street name in the uk ' , '' says the charity , which campaigns for `` all our streets to be fit for walking '' .
if you do n't enjoy walking , though , sweetpea way might be ideal as it overlooks the guided busway tracks to the city .
the winner will be announced in time for st valentine 's day .

documents.title: doubt cast over hospital services changes
text: senior councilors in southend have cast doubt on plans for changes to the way hospital services across most of essex are delivered .

cabinet members say they want to reserve the right to withdraw their support for the `` sustainability transformation plan '' ( stp ) - which could see some specialist services moved between hospitals - and more care given in the community .
a report discussed at a special meeting agrees that changes must be made to local health services - saying that doing nothing is not financially viable .
but it says some of the plans are n't backed up by clinical evidence , other parts are n't properly costed and describes others as `` unclear and poorly defined '' .

chair of the southend and mid essex stp , dr anita donley said : the consultation is an opportunity to hear views and feedback on the specific proposals around hospital services and it is right and proper the council debates its response as a significant partner in this . ''
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Essex Political Reporter

documents.title: campaign to shine light on landmarks
text: colchester 's `` heritage assets '' should be floodlit to make the area more attractive to visitors , a councillor has said .
conservative darius laws told bbc essex colchester borough council had not realised its full potential as britain 's oldest roman town .
`` you only have to go to other cities such as york and lincoln to see what they have done , '' he said .
`` they would kill to have the oldest city walls in the country .
we 've got them , but they are dark at night . ''
tim young , deputy leader of the labour-controlled council , said : `` i 'd love to see this done .
but we costed this a few years ago and it was about a quarter of a million pounds then . ''
he added spending public money could not be justified but the council would support a private investor .

text: southend united has paid its own tribute to club employee ray davy , who has died aged 88 .
on its website , it said mr davy had been an `` unbelievable servant to the club for 63 years '' .
it said he started his association with the blues at the age of 25 , in august 1955 , and had been a `` stalwart member '' ever since .

`` the list of jobs ray undertook at southend united is endless , including running the roots hall market three times a week when it was in its prime , organising roots hall stadium tours for local schools , dealing with charity requests , running the car park on match days and greeting fans and guests with his unique sense of humour and bright smile , just to name a few , '' it said .

documents.title: fire in care home bedroom leaves three needing ambulance treatment
text: a fire in a resident 's bedroom at a care home left three people needing treatment from paramedics and caused extensive smoke damage , essex fire and rescue service says .
three crews were sent to the home in spital road , maldon , at 06:05 this morning .

`` we were alerted to the incident by the careline service with reports that a smoke alarm in a care home was sounding , and on arrival crews discovered a well-developed fire in a resident 's bedroom , '' said station manager dan partridge .
the fire was on the ground floor , but firefighters searched the second and third floors for any casualties as the building was smoke logged .
three people suffered smoke inhalation , and an investigation will take place to establish what started the blaze .

documents.title: tributes to southend united man 'at heart of club '

ray davy welcomed countless visitors on match days , trips and tours and has been described as being `` at the heart of the club '' .
the shrimpers trust said it was `` deeply saddened '' to hear of mr davy 's death .

documents.title: weather update : rail services disrupted
text: we are getting reports that many rail services are being disrupted due to high winds damaging overhead electric wires and trees on railway lines .
national rail said journeys to and from london kings cross are being affected as an object has been caught in power lines between peterborough and stevenage .
trains are having to run at a reduced speed between these two stations and as a result may be delayed by up to 60 minutes , cancelled or revised .
greater anglia said due to high winds all lines between colchester and ipswich are blocked and disruption to services are expected until 10:00 .
the line between stowmarket and norwich is also closed due to loss of overhead power supply , and services between london liverpool street and norwich are suspended between ipswich and norwich .
trees have also fallen on to the tracks , which have caused damage to some trains .
this is affecting services between marks tey and sudbury , as well as between ipswich and lowestoft and in the wivenhoe area .
there is also a fault with the signalling system between north walsham and cromer , which has resulted in norwich to sheringham services being suspended .

documents.title: european cash boost for great yarmouth market traders
text: stallholders on great yarmouth market are due to receive about £ 200,000 from europe to boost the revival of markets in england and across the channel .
the go trade project has been set up to help nine town centres in southern england and france , which have seen dwindling visitor numbers .
great yarmouth will be handed 224,000 euros to spend on a digital click-and-collect service , training for market traders , new branding and tourism promotions .
stallholders will also receive permission to let them trade at other markets taking part in the project .

it was announced last month that basildon , in essex , will lead the anglo-france project and its market will benefit , while hadleigh and canvey island will get new town centre markets under the scheme over the next three-and-a-half years .

it performs maintenance tasks at the prison , where lindsay whitehouse was formerly deputy governor :
`` if the cell was unusable because the toilet was n't working , that would mean the prison would effectively be locking out prisoners , '' he said .
`` prisoners would have to probably be kept overnight in police cells , which would be a big call on essex police manpower .
`` the implications could be pretty rapid and quite severe .
all the key services - the electricity , the plumbing , are absolutely vital . ''

documents.title: thugs hunted after fancy dress attack on train
text: a man dressed as a penguin was attacked by a group on a train after being asked if he supported tottenham hotspur .
the 19-year-old and his father suffered cuts and bruises to their faces and bodies as they travelled on a greater anglia train from london liverpool street to chelmsford at 23:50 on 20 december .
the incident happened when the man wearing a fancy dress costume was waiting outside a toilet on the train .
one of a group of six men sitting nearby asked him if he supported tottenham .
after using the toilet , the men blocked his route back to his seat and become aggressive .
when his father , 56 , tried to pull him away , the group began punching and kicking the pair .
the disorder spilled out onto the platform at chelmsford station .

text: tributes have been paid to marie norris , who died after waiting nearly four hours for an ambulance
rachel reid , who runs a line-dancing club attended by mrs norris , said : `` she loved a bit of fun and was so full of life .
`` i was sad to hear the news .
she always danced at the front of the class and came in as recently as the week before christmas .
`` she was a happy soul and took part in the beginners class . ''
another friend , margaret dorrington said : `` she was an elegant and well-dressed lady for her age who kept her house and garden well .
she was a lovely woman . ''

documents.title: ambulance-wait woman 's friend wishes she could have helped
text: a close friend and neighbour has expressed regret that she was unable to help an 81-year-old woman who suffered chest pains and died after waiting nearly four hours for an ambulance to arrive .
marie norris , whose home in clacton was less than a mile ( 1.5km ) from the ambulance depot , called 999 at about 20:00 on 1 january but paramedics did not arrive until 23:46 .
she was alone in the house but help was nearby .
her friend and neighbour jenny spalding ( said : `` i do n't know why she did n't call me , but it 's too late now . ''
east of england ambulance service apologised and blamed the delay on the high level of demand .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: miniature horse brings christmas joy to hospital patients
text: a tiny horse has been bringing festive cheer to southend hospital , where he 's been visiting elderly patients with dementia .
`` applause '' , as he 's called , stands just 28 inches ( 71cm ) high and is 14 years old .

`` he can be very mischievous at home , but put him next to a two-year-old child with a brain tumour or at a fundraiser with fire engine sirens going off , and he knows his job , '' said amanda poulton , the horse 's owner from alamanda therapy animals .
clinical development nurse claire buckell said : `` in the past 'doggy therapy ' has proved very positive , so when the opportunity came up to have a miniature horse we jumped at it .
`` any change to the daily routine for people who are unwell can really make a difference and applause had such a fantastic positive impact . ''

documents.title: emirates to start route between stansted and dubai
text: the airline emirates has announced it 's going to start flying to stansted airport from june next year .
the new route will connect dubai and the north essex terminal and will see boeing 777-300er planes fly each day .

`` we 're delighted that emirates has recognised the strength of london stansted 's catchment and the opportunity that our available runway capacity gives them to continue growing in the south east of england over the next decade , '' said stansted 's chief executive ken o'toole .

documents.title: elderly care home resident died after catheter issues , inquest hears
text: an 87-year-old woman died at a care home after staff failed to monitor her catheter adequately and two litres of urine built up , an inquest heard .
sylvia macknay became unwell at haven lodge in clacton in september 2016 , after having moved there the previous month .

chelmsford coroner 's court heard when her daughter visited on 3 september , her mother - who had multiple health problems , was bed bound , fed through a tube and had a catheter fitted - seemed to be in extreme discomfort .
when the catheter was removed and re-fitted , there was about two litres of urine .
mrs macknay was taken to hospital where she died shortly after arrival .
recording a narrative verdict , coroner caroline beasley-murray said lessons had been learned at the care home , where staff had been retrained in catheter care .

documents.title: murder police want to identify man on bicycle
text: police investigating the death of a man in lawford , near colchester , say they want to speak to a man who was riding round on a bike and knocking on people 's doors a few hours before the victim was found .
john comer , 46 , was found with injuries to his chest and stomach in barker close at 05:15 on 1 december and later died in hospital .
officers say a man riding a red rayleigh firefly bicycle was knocking on doors and asking people for directions at 02:50 in the wignall stree/long road area of manningtree .
they want to hear from anyone who recognises the bicycle , which had reportedly been stolen .
patrick chandler , 44 , has been charged with murder and is due in court in february .

documents.title: mps send condolences over death of deputy speaker 's daughter
text: mps have been expressing their condolences in parliament over the sudden death of the commons deputy speaker lindsay hoyle 's daughter .
natalie lewis-hoyle , 28 , was found unconscious at an address at heybridge on friday morning .
her mother miriam lewis is a conservative councillor in maldon .
the family are appealing for anyone with information to come forward .

in the commons , the snp 's neil gray said : `` can i take this opportunity of behalf of the snp benches to offer my sincere condolences to the deputy speaker after the weekend 's tragic incidents , and our hearts , thoughts and prayers certainly go out to lindsay and his family . ''

labour 's margaret greenwood said thoughts were with mr hoyle and his family , and work and pensions secretary david gauke said the `` thoughts of the whole house [ were ] with him at this moment '' .

documents.title: nuclear power site investigation works get go-ahead
text: maldon district council says permission has been given for some `` early investigative works '' to be carried out at the planned site for a new nuclear power station at bradwell-on-sea .
the china general nuclear power corporation and edf energy are involved in the proposals , which could see a new site built to the east of the previous power station (
engineers will be drilling boreholes to find out more about the local geology , and a number of trial pits are set to be excavated .
the local authority 's leader , mark durham , said the work was not expected to have an impact on the local community .

`` there is no firm timetable for the bradwell b proposals , as the project is at such an early stage , but residents will be kept updated and consulted as plans develop , '' a council spokesman said .
